jpo
Class SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode
      jpo.SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, javax.swing.tree.MutableTreeNode, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.tree.TreeNode
public class SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode
extends javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode
implements java.lang.Comparable, java.io.Serializable

This class extends the DefaultMutableTreeNode with the Comparable Interface that allows our nodes to be compared.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

treeModel

private javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel treeModel
This variable is initialised only on the root node. It references the treeModel that will handle otification of changes.

sortfield

private static int sortfield
This field records the field by which the group is to be sorted. This is not very elegant as a second sort could run at the same time and clobber this global variable. But that's not very likely on a single user app like this.

unsavedUpdates

private boolean unsavedUpdates
This variable indicates whether uncommited changes exist for this collection. Care should be taken when adding removing or changing nodes to update this flag. It should be queried before exiting the application. Also when a new collection is loaded this flag should be checked so as not to loose modifications. This flag should be set only on the root node.

See Also:
setUnsavedUpdates(), setUnsavedUpdates(boolean), getUnsavedUpdates()

allowEdits

private boolean allowEdits
This flag controls whether this collection can be edited. This is queried by several menus and will restrict the options a use has if it returns true.

sendModelUpdates

public static boolean sendModelUpdates
controls whether updates should be fired from add, delete, insert methods

xmlFile

public java.io.File xmlFile
A file reference to the file that was loaded. It will come in handy when a save instruction comes along.

Method Detail

initialiseNewCollection

public void initialiseNewCollection()
method that sets up a new collection

createDefaultTreeModel

public void createDefaultTreeModel()
Call this method when you create the root node of the tree. The DefaultTreeModel allows notification of tree change events to listening objects.

getTreeModel

public javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel getTreeModel()
Call this method when you create the root node of the tree. The DefaultTreeModel allows notification of tree change events to listening objects. The DefaultTreeModel is the one from the root node regardless of which node you call this method on.

getRootNode

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode getRootNode()
returns the root node. This is a convenience method.

Returns:
The root node of the JTree.

sortChildren

public void sortChildren(int sortCriteria)
Call this method to sort the Children of a node by a field. The field codes are the ones in the Settings object.

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
Overriden method to allow sorting of nodes. It uses the static global variable sortfield to figure out what to compare on.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable

getPreviousPicture

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode getPreviousPicture()
Returns the first node with a picture before the current one in the tree. It uses the getPreviousNode method of DefaultMutableTreeNode.

Returns:
the first node with a picture in preorder traversal or null if none found.

getNextPicture

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode getNextPicture()
Returns the next node with a picture found after current one in the tree. This can be in another Group. It uses the getNextNode method of the DefaultMutableTreeNode.

Returns:
The SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode that represents the next picture. If no picture can be found it returns null.

getNextGroupPicture

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode getNextGroupPicture()
Returns the next node with a picture found after current one in the current Group It uses the getNextSibling method of the DefaultMutableTreeNode.

Returns:
The SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode that represents the next picture. If no picture can be found it returns null.

findFirstPicture

public SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode findFirstPicture()
Returns the first child node under the current node which holds a PictureInfo object.

Returns:
The first child node holding a picture or null if none can be found.

public void setUnsavedUpdates()
This method marks the root node of the tree as having unsaved updates.

Parameters:

checkUnsavedChanges

public boolean checkUnsavedChanges()
method that checks for unsaved changes in the data model and asks if you really want to discard them. It returns true if the user want to cancel the close.

isInCollection

public boolean isInCollection(java.io.File f)
This method returns true if the indicated file is already a member of the collection. Otherwise it returns false.

Parameters:
f - The File object of the file to check for

isInCollection

public boolean isInCollection(long checksum)
This method returns true if the indicated checksum is already a member of the collection. Otherwise it returns false.

Parameters:
checksum - The checksum of the picture to check for

runUserFunction

public void runUserFunction(int userFunction)
This method fires up a user function if it can. User functions are only valid on PictureInfo nodes.

Parameters:
userFunction - The user function to be executed

executeDrop

public void executeDrop(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDropEvent event)
This method is called by the drop method of the DragTarget to do the move. It deals with the intricacies of the drop event and handles all the moving, cloning and positioning that is required.

Parameters:
event - The event the listening object received.

deleteNode

public boolean deleteNode()
This method removes the designated SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode from the tree. The parent node is made the currently selected node.

Returns:
true if successful, false if not

copyToNewLocation

public void copyToNewLocation()
brings up a file chooser and allows the user to specify where the image should to be copied to and then copies it.

validateAndCopyPicture

public void validateAndCopyPicture(java.io.File targetFile)
Validates the target of the picture copy instruction and tries to find the appropriate thing to do:

1. If any input is null the copy is aborted with an error dialog.
2: If the target is a directory the filename of the original is used.
3: If the target is an existing file the copy is aborted
4: If the target directory doesn't exist then the directories are created.
5: The file extension is made to be that of the original if it isn't already that.
When all preconditions are met the image is copied

Parameters:
targetFile - The target location for the new Picture.

addPictures

public void addPictures(java.io.File[] chosenFiles,
                        boolean newOnly,
                        boolean recurseDirectories)
Adds the indicated files to the current node if they are valid pictures. If the newOnly Flag is on then the collection is checked to see if the picture is already present. It also opens a progress Gui to provide feedback to the user.

Parameters:
newOnly - indicates whether to check if the picture is already in the collection
recurseDirectories - indicates whether to scan down into directories for more pictures.

copyAddPictures

public void copyAddPictures(java.io.File sourceDir,
                            java.io.File targetDir,
                            java.lang.String groupName,
                            boolean newOnly)
Copies the pictures from the source tree to the target directory and adds them to the collection.

Parameters:
newOnly - If true only pictures not yet in the collection will be added.

copyAddPictures1

protected static void copyAddPictures1(java.io.File[] files,
                                       java.io.File targetDir,
                                       SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode receivingNode,
                                       ProgressGui progGui,
                                       boolean newOnly)
Copies the pictures from the source tree to the target directory and adds them to the collection. This method does the actual loop.

copyAddPictures

public void copyAddPictures(java.io.File sourceDir,
                            java.io.File targetDir,
                            java.lang.String groupName,
                            Camera cam)
Copies the pictures from the source tree to the target directory and adds them to the collection only if they have not been seen by the camera before.

Parameters:
cam - The camera object with knows the checksums of the pictures seen before.

copyAddPictures1

protected static void copyAddPictures1(java.io.File[] files,
                                       java.io.File targetDir,
                                       SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode receivingNode,
                                       ProgressGui progGui,
                                       Camera cam)
Copies the pictures from the source tree to the target directory and adds them to the collection. This method does the actual loop.

addDirectory

private void addDirectory(java.io.File dir,
                          boolean newOnly,
                          boolean recurseDirectories,
                          ProgressGui progGui)
method that is invoked resursively on each directory encoundered. It adds a new group to the tree and then adds all the pictures found therein to that group. The ImageIO.getImageReaders method is queried to see whether a reader exists for the image that is attempted to be loaded.

addSinglePicture

public boolean addSinglePicture(java.io.File addFile,
                                boolean newOnly)
this method adds a new Picture if it is not yet in the collection.

Parameters:
addFile - the file that should be added
newOnly - whether to check if the picture is in the collection already
Returns:
true if the picture was valid, false if not.

addPicture

public boolean addPicture(java.io.File addFile)
this method adds a new Picture to the current node if the JVM has a reader for it.

Parameters:
addFile - the file that should be added
Returns:
true if the picture was valid, false if not.

refreshThumbnail

public void refreshThumbnail()
this method can be called to refresh the thumbnail of the node. It places a request on the Queue. When the ThumbnailCreationThread picks it up it will send a PictureInfo.sendThumbnailChangedEvent() event.

rotatePicture

public void rotatePicture(int angle)
this method can be called to rotate the image of the node.
